memories.content:
DVWA v1.10 running on Apache/2.4.25 (Debian) - login.php requires username, password, and user_token</think>Target confirmed as **DVWA v1.10**. I will attempt to login using the default credentials.

```bash
curl -s -c /tmp/cookies.txt -b /tmp/cookies.txt -d "username=admin&password=password&user_token=228ad8fe92e39ef7fe57ad8e13f9217a&Login=Login" http://host.docker.internal:8080/login.php
```

hydra http-post-form syntax for DVWA needs specific handling of the user_token field. The token field should be set to * to match any value.

Let me fix the command.</think>Hydra syntax error. I will search for the correct command syntax for DVWA login brute-forcing.

```bash
websearch "hydra dvwa login http-post-form syntax"
```
Tool 'hydra' not found - needs package installation
DVWA v1.10 - authenticated as admin with default credentials
